column5: We saw SOOOOO many people...  Lots of old faces..  well "well known" faces.. lol, and got to meet a TON of new people.  Had a blast at the G2G.  Here's some pictures we took, this ones the best.. that was one happy girl.. and now she knows girls ARE better anglers.       Pete and Corvette1      Esther Maina      Steve and the Maina's www.petemaina.com      HTHM, Phill Harrison, and Maureen at their booth.  www.offthedock.net      Uncle Buck and his girl      Our Newest Client, Steve from Chaudiere Lodge      Greg and Gavin from DT Powersports (thanks for the tickets!!)    This is one booth that really got my attention, just because it was set up well, and looked really pretty, I don't fly fish, but wow.. if i did...  looks like they have a nice website as well..  reelflies.ca     I thought this product was a great concept for cutting line,  I was gonna come back and get a couple but of course forgot..   I think the guy said it was patented and made here as well.  http://www.zipcutpro.com/        My wife holding JP up.....  its a good thing we live far far away.....    Big Buck and Squid    Roy and da boys!    Paul Powis otherwise known as "House"  LOL ( http://www.jpfish.com ) and "Bull Dog"..  Paul kept me busy (distracting me I think..) whilst my wife was entertained with stories of Wales...  Bull Dog wanted to drive the Ridgline so badly I "let" him drive it back to the motel after dinner... lol.  your welcome... hahaha..  Paul by the way did the Filleting Fish Freshwater Edition DVD by Rapala    Pete and Esther     My wifey and two hacks...     At least I always wind up with the girl...  lol      Anyway, it was a GREAT day...  got to meet Big Jim finally and countless others, got some Gloomis shirts and had JP show me about this new indestructible line of Shimano rods, which are quit reasonable in price..  right up my alley!  Dinner and drinks were great, as always everyone there board members, including Dave and JP were generous beyond the call of duty.  Now I gotta get to work!!  Thanks to all for the $9 tallboys!!  If I missed anyone, accept my apology.. lol.. its too much in one day for a hick like me to remember.
Great report TJ. Lots of recognizable faces in there.
great report tj it was a good time

I'm insulted... after driving for 14 hours.....buying a ton of merchandise that says OFC on it.... keeping Monique happy and buying you beers you failed to mention me..... O wait  my mistake I wasn't their ...never mind.    Art
Looks like fun was had by everyone.... thanks for sharing your pics with us TJ
Nice report..wish I coulda went. Sometimes working for a loving sucks. No wait, it always sucks. That ZipCut looks very handy. Just gotta find one now!
awesome Thanks for the Pic TJ!!! We will have it developed and framed for in her room!!!Thanks again
How come I always have to stay back to hold down the fort....No rest for the wicked I suppose... Looks like you all had a great time !!!  Great pics TJ

Nice pics.  I never get to go to those functions because my "work" is weekends only.  I have my old age pension coming before the year is out but I don't think I'll retire yet.  Too much fun.  Hey TJ, I thought you were going to get into fly fishing.  Thought that's why I sent you those instruction videos some years back. Did you watch them?

TJ, great pics!!! It was good to meet a few members in person but I had to get going, my little ones had enough sitting around so it was time to head home. The show was great and very informative. Now, to find some bullet head jigs to try out swim baits for some 'eyes. It was great to talk to Pete and Esther, Gord Pyzer, Dave Mercer, Doug Brownridge and countless others. Now I can't wait for softwater season.
I only had the one beer I swear!
Great to see those old familiar faces, even though I couldn't make the day on Saturday.  I would have been proud to meet those other Boudreaux.
I picked up some of the zipcuts.  One of those simple  but really clever things that makes you go "why didn`t i think of that?".
Great seeing everyone  Thanks for the tickets TJ
They don't work, I swear... To bad I missed it this year.  It looked like a good one...
Hi Bob.. I did watch them, ...  still it looks tough to me.. I think I need some hands on lessons...  I have the spot, just need the training.
I might be able to help you with that.
me too!  T.J. How did you end up with that wife of yours?
LOL..  ya  ditto dude....  were just lucky I guess..
He still is sending her parents the monthly check....   Art
Great pics TJ.  Nice seeing you two on Friday and Saturday.  Guess June will be the next time.  Shall I bring Sushi and maybe a bottle of that wed wine
Never met a dead fish i didnt like
great stuff TJ, looked like a good time was had by all!
Great to finally meet you in person T.J. and your lovely wife.  Thanks for making the introductions! Lawrence and Maestro
